info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-ncch-cfg
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG
     definitions for configuration of NETCONF server Call Home.
     Copyright (c) 2020, 2022, 2024 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

**Configuration Module**
**Module:** `Cisco-IOS-XE-ncch-cfg`
**Paths:** 8

**📊 YANG Tree:** [View Cisco-IOS-XE-ncch-cfg structure](https://jeremycohoe.github.io/cisco-ios-xe-openapi-swagger/yang-trees/Cisco-IOS-XE-ncch-cfg.html)

get.description: Configures NETCONF server Call Home behavior.

put.description: Create or replace Configures NETCONF server Call Home behavior.

patch.description: Partially modify Configures NETCONF server Call Home behavior.

delete.description: Delete Configures NETCONF server Call Home behavior.

get.description:
Configure a list of NETCONF clients the NETCONF server is to
         maintain simultaneous call-home connections with.

put.description:
Create or replace Configure a list of NETCONF clients the NETCONF server is to
         maintain simultaneous call-home connections with.

patch.description:
Partially modify Configure a list of NETCONF clients the NETCONF server is to
         maintain simultaneous call-home connections with.

delete.description:
Delete Configure a list of NETCONF clients the NETCONF server is to
         maintain simultaneous call-home connections with.

List of NETCONF clients the NETCONF server is to
           maintain simultaneous call-home connections with. (collection)

post.description:

           maintain simultaneous call-home connections with. (collection)

tcpc-remote-port.description:
The NETCONF server will attempt to connect
         to the IANA-assigned well-known port 4334
         if no value is specified.

tcpc-local-ipaddr.description:
Specifies the local IP address to bind to for when
         connecting to the remote peer.

tcpc-local-port.description:
The local IP port number to bind to for when connecting
         to the remote peer.  The port number '0', which is the
         default value, indicates that any available local port
         number may be used.

tcpc-local-vrf.description: Network instance name for the local VRF

tcpc-remote-addr-unset.description:
Indicates address has not been specified.
             Value will be passed as-is.

tcpc-remote-ipaddr.description:
Specifies the IP address of the remote peer to
             establish a connection with.

name.description: An arbitrary name for the remote NETCONF client.

transport-unset.description:
Indicates transport has not been specified.
             Value will be passed as-is.

tcpc-remote-port.description:
The NETCONF server will attempt to connect
         to the IANA-assigned well-known port 4334
         if no value is specified.

tcpc-local-ipaddr.description:
Specifies the local IP address to bind to for when
         connecting to the remote peer.

tcpc-local-port.description:
The local IP port number to bind to for when connecting
         to the remote peer.  The port number '0', which is the
         default value, indicates that any available local port
         number may be used.

tcpc-local-vrf.description: Network instance name for the local VRF

tcpc-remote-addr-unset.description:
Indicates address has not been specified.
             Value will be passed as-is.

tcpc-remote-ipaddr.description:
Specifies the IP address of the remote peer to
             establish a connection with.

start-with.description:
Specifies which of the NETCONF client's endpoints
         the NETCONF server should start with when trying
         to connect to the NETCONF client.

max-attempts.description:
Specifies the number times the NETCONF server tries
         to connect to a specific endpoint before moving on
         to the next endpoint in the list (round robin).

ncch-client-endpoints.description: Configure a list of endpoints of the NETCONF client.

start-with.description:
Specifies which of the NETCONF client's endpoints
         the NETCONF server should start with when trying
         to connect to the NETCONF client.

max-attempts.description:
Specifies the number times the NETCONF server tries
         to connect to a specific endpoint before moving on
         to the next endpoint in the list (round robin).

reconnect-strategy.description:
The reconnection strategy directs how a NETCONF server
         reconnects to a NETCONF client, after discovering its
         connection to the client has dropped, even if due to a
         reboot. The NETCONF server starts with the specified
         endpoint and tries to connect to it max-attempts times
         before trying the next endpoint in the list (round
         robin).
